My Rainbow Baby journey ğŸ˜¢ğŸŒˆ

Many people donâ€™t know that Tyson is a rainbow babyğŸŒˆğŸ‘¶ğŸ½. For those that donâ€™t know what that means, itâ€™s that Tyson came after us miscarrying our baby before him. Itâ€™s taken a few years to decide if we wanted to share this, and just as long to feel comfortable taking about it. 

After hearing of struggles to get pregnant and miscarriages from people around us, we felt that we wanted to share so that others going through this feel less alone, as well as to give some hope. 

In early 2017, my husband and I got the wonderful news that we were going to have a baby, we were ecstatic and began planning for this blessed baby's arrival. I chatted with the baby regularly, and planned its nursery, planned our announcement etc. 

Then suddenly, just past 12 weeks, we lost our beloved baby. The pain, sadness and loneliness that goes along with this was unimaginable. Iâ€™m not sure why there is so much secrecy around a miscarriage here in North America, itâ€™s makes it so much worse. 

Not everything was â€˜evacuatedâ€™ when it happened so I was still carrying the baby after the miscarriage. When I asked my doctor what to do, she said I had to wait for it to pass naturally (which isnâ€™t true for everyone) ğŸ˜

For 9 months I still had all the hormones and the baby which made it so much harder to get past what happened. When I eventually found a new doctor, she took care of me and helped us to complete this chapter. We were finally able to mourn & have closure. When we were ready, we tried again ğŸ˜€

We are thankful that all the stars aligned to bring us the most special gift of our life, and the following year we got the news that we were pregnant again and Tyson was on his way. The main reason to share this story is to give hope to those out there going though some of the challenges of this. We send love to our little angel in heaven, and thanks for our little Tyson. 

 Sending hope, love & baby dust to anyone in needâ€¦ hugs xoxo â¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸŒˆ

#normalizemiscarriage  #rainbowbaby #miscarriages

I want to show you one of my favorite hacks for getting my daily water in! Now ideally you wanna aim to get in 2 to 3 liters of water in per day. I know!

 Thatâ€™s a looootttaÂ of water! And if you are not used to drinking so much water, there is definitely a learning curve! Below you will find my tip for staying hydrated and a trick on how to make water taste yummy!

Infused watermelon and basil  water ğŸ‰ ğŸŒ¿ Â  

The flavor is a water melony with a hint of basil, but, the scent of the basil as you drink it is intoxicating. Scrunch the basil in your hands before adding to the water to increase the flavor. Give it at least 2 hours in the fridge to soak up the flavor.

I like to let all infused water sit at least 2 hours but not more than two days before drinking.  You can make little waters like this or make one big jug to finish that day.Â Try to use organic produce and wash everything thoroughly.
